abstract: Political pressures cast a new shadow over Rio Tinto‘s planned $19.5 billion tie-up with the Chinese government-owned Chinalco, knocking Rio’s shares down as much as 10 percent on Wednesday, with Australia’s Senate saying it would examine foreign investment, Reuters said.
lead_paragraph: Political pressures cast a new shadow over Rio Tinto‘s planned $19.5 billion tie-up with the Chinese government-owned Chinalco, knocking Rio’s shares down as much as 10 percent on Wednesday, with Australia’s Senate saying it would examine foreign investment, Reuters said.

headline.main: Australian Senate’s Move Weighs on Rio Shares

abstract: The mining group Rio Tinto has appointed Jan du Plessis, the chairman of British American Tobacco, to head its board as well, the company said on Tuesday.
lead_paragraph: The mining group Rio Tinto has appointed Jan du Plessis, the chairman of British American Tobacco, to head its board as well, the company said on Tuesday.

headline.main: British Tobacco Chairman to Chair Rio Tinto, Too
